title: Science and Humility:  The DISC, consensus thinking & Federal funding inhibiting innovation
description:
What has happened to the sense of humility in science? Making a virtue of vice.
Promoting self-esteem as the highest virtue and humility as an aberration.
Is humility necessary??
What are the major concerns?

Consensus thinking became more of a thing when federal money started pouring into
Science during the Manhattan Project. Grant applications are tedious, time consuming and uncertain, and tend to go towards specified directions, removing some of the freedom to choose a path of discovery.
Big expenditures like the Hadron collider.
Federal bureaucrats are the gatekeepers to the government’s deep pockets.

We are discussing some ideas that were exposed in depth in The Portal podcast with Eric Weinstein interviewing Brett Weinstein (the DISC) and also his interview with Roger Penrose regarding spin theory and twistor theory.

Article by Ira on Humility:  https://www.lewrockwell.com/2020/02/ira-katz/humility/

The Portal with Eric Weinstein
With Brett Weinstein, Episode 19
With Roger Penrose, Episode 20
https://podcasts.google.com/?feed=aHR0cHM6Ly9yc3MuYXJ0MTkuY29tL3RoZS1wb3J0YWw&ved=0CAAQ4aUDahcKEwiQ0cTBwqznAhUAAAAAHQAAAAAQAQ&hl=en

See also Nima Arkani Hamed’s lecture at Cornell on the Morality of Fundamental Physics
https://www.cornell.edu/video/nima-arkani-hamed-morality-fundamental-physics

Much funding is directed either towards 1) what is already working, incremental changes on a PHD thesis for example, rather than on new ideas or 2) what everyone wants to be working on because it’s the “in” thing, string theory for example.  In both of these examples, it is possible to get deeper and deeper into very small channels, or become overly abstract.

As research goes, once it gets into the newspaper, you can be assured it is being way overblown and not taking the inherent limitations into account. Every good paper has a section on limitations, scoping the whole problem.

He sees string theory as divorced from reality, a theoretical idea as abstract as a mathematical construct. 

C. S. Lewis’ Discarded Image

Statements of fact differ from reality.
All that we know for sure is that all happens as if our description were true, not whether it actually explains reality.

Theory should be seen only as a provisional understanding of the truth, knowing that we will understand it more fully in the future.

His experience with his brother taught him how the psychiatric profession fudges on the impact of certain pharmaceuticals. Whenever we are trying to quantify behavior, we must be humble and remember that we are dealing with human beings, in the messy middle.

The distinction between technology and Science where equations were used in engineering, cathedrals were built without equations.

Technological growth is very entrepreneurial and empirical in the past, but now it’s mostly technocrats who have become incredibly wealthy moving to the top of the hierarchy and gaining influence.

There’s a danger of over classifying.

Some scientists see themselves as pure truth-seeking beings, but they are not, any more than are we. They think they are perfectly objective, but no one is. Even the choice of a subject to investigate is a very subjective act. 

The distinctions between chaos, chaos theory and complexity theory.

Watch out for any place that power becomes too concentrated, whether it is in government or in bureaucracy or in the hierarchies of science or technology. 

Next time, we plan to talk about the difference between in initial value problem and 
An initial boundary value problem.
Initial conditions, boundary conditions, fluid mechanics and the transition to turbulent flow.
In order to do so, there is an empirical statistical value that you reinsert.

Karen’s art website:  www.karenwongart.com
Karen’s blog:  www.TheMeaningCode.com
